text: Henri Mathé (1837-1907) was a French politician. ==Early life== Henri Mathé was born on May 27, 1837 in Moulins, in rural France.National Assembly: Henri MathéJean-Marie Mayeur (ed.), Les parlementaires de la Seine sous la Troisième République: Etudes, Paris: Publications de la Sorbonnes, 2001, Volume 1, pp. 411-412 His father died when he was three years old, and he was adopted by his paternal uncle, Antoine Félix Mathé. He had a brother, Félix Mathé. He graduated from the ESCP Europe, a business school in Paris. ==Career== He served as a member of the Chamber of Deputies from 1885 to 1893. ==Personal life== He married Jeanne Elisa Billot. ==Death== He died on October 27, 1907 in Paris, France. ==References== Category:1837 births Category:1907 deaths Category:People from Moulins, Allier Category:Politicians from Auvergne-Rhône- Alpes Category:French republicans Category:Members of the 4th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:Members of the 5th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic
title: Henri Mathé
